definition: system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: Britain converted to decimal currency on February 15th, 1971.
sentences.chinese: 英国于1971年2月15日改用十进位币制。

sentences.english: Credit system is based on money system.
sentences.chinese: 信用制度是以货币制度为基础的。

sentences.english: China's Renminbi has a decimal system.
sentences.chinese: 中国的人民币采用的是十进币制。

sentences.english: The unification of Monetary System of Qin dynasty didn't help advance economic development at that time.
sentences.chinese: 秦朝推行币制统一在现实中并没有促进经济发展。

sentences.english: Do you have a need to handle multi-currency transactions?
sentences.chinese: 您是否需要处理多币制的事务？

sentences.english: In 1971 Britain changed over to the new decimal money system.
sentences.chinese: 1971年英国改用新的十进位币制。

sentences.english: As we face the future, the prognosis for the dollar and for the international monetary system is grim indeed.
sentences.chinese: 面向将来，美元及国际货币制度的前景确实严峻。

sentences.english: The Russians had not succeeded in imposing monetary discipline on themselves.
sentences.chinese: 俄国人却没能达成货币制度强加在自己身上。

sentences.english: Proceeding in an orderly way is the basic mentality of Liang Qichao's currency system reformation.
sentences.chinese: 循序渐进是梁启超币制改革的基本思路。

sentences.english: Britain converted from the old system in 1971.
Britain converted her money from the old system to a decimal one.
sentences.chinese: 英国废弃旧币制，改为十进制。

sentences.english: The monetary reform was an important task hosted by Gaogong in Jiajing and Longqing dynasties.
sentences.chinese: 币制改革是高拱主持隆庆朝大改革的重要内容。

definition: flat silver (former coinage)/also written 銀圓|银圆/silver dollar
fractional currency (coin or note of value smaller than the country's unit of currency)/token (used instead of money for slot machines etc)
flat silver (former coinage)/also written 銀元|银元/silver dollar
local currency/our own currency/abbr. to 本幣|本币
copper coin of the Ming and Qing Dynasties
to cast (pour metal into a mold)
